statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Lamond Murray Jr. scored 16 points and Stacy Davis had 13, including four free throws in the final 24 seconds, to lead Pepperdine to a 69-63 win over Saint Mary's on Thursday night, handing the G
article.headline: Pepperdine beats Saint Mary's for the second time, 69-63
article.linkText: Pepperdine beats Saint Mary's for the second time, 69-63
article.story: MORAGA, Calif. -- Lamond Murray Jr. scored 16 points and Stacy Davis had 13, including four free throws in the final 24 seconds, to lead Pepperdine to a 69-63 win over Saint Mary's on Thursday night, handing the Gaels their first home loss of the season. The game was tied at 30 at halftime and the biggest lead for the Waves was the final score. Jock Landale's tipin with 27.7 seconds left pulled Saint Mary's with 65-63 but Davis answered with two free throws and then made two more after rebounding Landale's miss with 14 seconds left. Amadi Udenyi added 14 points for the Waves (15-10, 8-6 WCC), who beat the Gaels 67-63 in their first meeting. Pepperdine shot 58 percent (15 of 26). Evan Fitzner had 15 points for Saint Mary's (19-3, 10-3), who fell 1 1/2 games behind Gonzaga. The Gaels, who are 15-1 at home, were 4 of 19 behind the arc and 5 of 14 from the foul line.
